title: Kirchhoff junction - describe current at point P

content.description: The figure shows a circuit built from a battery and four resistors with the indicated resistances. The currents in two of the resistors are also indicated. Which of the following claims correctly describes the direction and the magnitude of the current at Point <math alttext="P" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">P</mi></math>?
content.question: Direction of current at point <math alttext="P" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">P</mi></math>Magnitude of current at point <math alttext="P" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">P</mi></math>AToward the leftLess than both <math alttext="I sub R" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>I</mi><mi>R</mi></msub></math> and <math alttext="I sub 4 R, end sub" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>I</mi><mrow><mn>4</mn><mi>R</mi></mrow></msub></math>BToward the leftIn between <math alttext="I sub R" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>I</mi><mi>R</mi></msub></math> and <math alttext="I sub 4 R, end sub" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>I</mi><mrow><mn>4</mn><mi>R</mi></mrow></msub></math>CToward the rightLess than both <math alttext="I sub R" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>I</mi><mi>R</mi></msub></math> and <math alttext="I sub 4 R, end sub" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>I</mi><mrow><mn>4</mn><mi>R</mi></mrow></msub></math>DToward the rightIn between <math alttext="I sub R" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>I</mi><mi>R</mi></msub></math> and <math alttext="I sub 4 R, end sub" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>I</mi><mrow><mn>4</mn><mi>R</mi></mrow></msub></math>

skill.text: 3.B: Apply an appropriate law, definition, theoretical relationship, or model to make a claim.
